author: Special Correspondent
text:
A high mast lamp commissioned at the Ganirowther Tank signified the start of beautification works of the water body for which the State Government has sanctioned Rs. 10 crore.

During this financial year, Rs. 4 crore is likley to be spent. Environment Minister Thoppu N.D. Venkatachalam dedicated the lamp to the public on Sunday.

The Government’s sanction of funds for conversion of the hitherto neglected tank into an entertainment location followed sustained struggle by the Ganirowther Tank Retrieval Movement for removal of encroachments.

Last month, members of the Movement staged a demonstration demanding timely utilisation of the funds for beautification. They sought harnessing of water accruing from the Northeast Monsoon rain.

The water body on a 14-hectare expanse will, in due course, be deepened for raising the level of water table, and have pavements, fountains and lawns.

In the preceding weeks, the City Corporation removed encroachments on the bund and along canals conveying rain water into the tank.
title: Beautification of tank begins
